Reference

All functions

additive_mle()

Use mgcv to fit the projection to the posterior draws for additive multilevel models.

break_up_matrix_term()

Sometimes there can be terms in a formula that refer to a matrix instead of a single predictor. Because we can handle search_terms of predictors, this function breaks the matrix term into individual predictors to handle separately, as that is probably the intention of the user.

collapse_contrasts_solution_path()

collapse a list of terms including contrasts

count_terms_chosen()

Given a refmodel structure, count the number of terms included.

count_terms_in_formula()

Utility to count the number of terms in a given formula.

count_terms_in_group_term()

Utility to count the number of terms in a given group term.

cvfolds() cv_ids()

Create cross-validation indices

cv_varsel()

Cross-validated variable selection (varsel)

delete.intercept()

remove intercept from formula

df_binom

Binomial toy example.

df_gaussian

Gaussian toy example.

.tabulate_stats()

copied from summary_funs to remove duplicated code

eval_rhs()

Helper function to evaluate right hand side formulas in a context

extend_family()

Add extra fields to the family object.

Student_t()

Extra family objects.

extract_response()

At any point inside projpred, the response can be a single object or instead it can represent multiple outputs. In this function we recover the response/s as a character vector so we can index the dataframe.

extract_terms_response()

This function splits the given formula in response (left) and predictors (right).

flatten_additive_terms()

Remove duplicated additive terms.

flatten_formula()

By combining different submodels we may arrive to a formula with repeated terms. This function gets rid of duplicated terms_.

flatten_group_terms()

Unifies group terms removing any duplicates.

flatten_individual_terms()

Remove duplicated linear terms.

flatten_interaction_terms()

Remove duplicated linear interaction terms.

formula2str()

convert a formula to a character string

formula_contains_additive_terms()

Checks whether a formula contains additive terms or not.

formula_contains_group_terms()

Checks whether a formula contains group terms or not.

get-refmodel

Get reference model structure

get_contrasts_arg_list()

construct contrasts.arg list argument for model.matrix based on the current model's formula.

get_replace_response()

Utility to just replace the response in the data frame

is_next_submodel_redundant()

Utility that checks if the next submodel is redundant with the current one.

lhs()

Extract left hand side of a formula as a formula itself by removing the right hand side.

linear_multilevel_mle()

Use lmer to fit the projection to the posterior draws for multilevel models.

make_formula()

Subsets a formula by the given terms.

mesquite

Mesquite data set.

parse_additive_terms()

Parse additive terms from a list of individual terms. These may include individual smoothers s(x), interaction smoothers s(x, z), smooth intercepts s(factor, bs = "re"), group level independent smoothers s(x, by = g), or shared smoothers for low dimensional factors s(x, g, bs = "fs"), interaction group level smoothers with same shape for high dimensional factors t2(x, z, g, bs = c(., ., "re")), interaction group level independent smoothers te(x, z, by = g), population level interaction smoothers te(x, z, bs = c(., .)), s(x, z).

parse_args_cv_varsel()

Auxiliary function for parsing the input arguments for specific cv_varsel. This is similar in spirit to parse_args_varsel, that is, to avoid the main function to become too long and complicated to maintain.

plot(<vsel>)

Plot summary statistics related to variable selection

predict(<refmodel>)

Predict method for reference model objects

print(<vsel>)

Print methods for vsel/vsel objects

proj_linpred() proj_predict()

Extract draws of the linear predictor and draw from the predictive distribution of the projected submodel

projpred

Projection predictive feature selection

reduce_models()

Utility to remove redundant models to consider

search_L1_surrogate()

copied over from search until we resolve the TODO below

select_possible_terms_size()

Select next possible terms without surpassing a specific size

sort_submodels_by_size()

Given a list of formulas, sort them by the number of terms in them.

split_additive_term()

Plugs the main effects to the smooth additive term if `by` argument is provided.

split_formula()

Simplify and split a formula by breaking it into all possible submodels.

split_group_term()

Simplify a single group term by breaking it down in as many terms_ as varying effects. It also explicitly adds or removes the varying intercept.

split_interaction_term()

Plugs the main effects to the interaction terms to consider jointly for projection.

split_linear_term()

Splits a linear term into individual predictors.

subset_formula_and_data()

Utility to both subset the formula and update the data

suggest_size()

Suggest model size

suggest_size(<vsel>)

Suggest model size

summary(<vsel>)

Summary statistics related to variable selection

to_character_rhs()

Cast a right hand side formula to a character vector.

validate_resp_formula()

validate formulas dedicated to response variables

validate_response_formula()

Because the formula can imply multiple or single response, in this function we make sure that a formula has a single response. Then, in the case of multiple responses we split the formula.

varsel()

Variable selection for generalized linear models
